title: Pediatric Dental Assistant - Queens Based
description:
Are you passionate about providing quality dental care to children? Do you have a warm and friendly demeanor that puts young patients at ease? We have an exciting opportunity for a Pediatric Dental Assistant to join our dedicated team and make a positive impact on the oral health of our youngest patients.


At New York Family Dentistry, we are committed to delivering exceptional dental care in a comfortable and welcoming environment. Our team of professionals is dedicated to ensuring children have positive dental experiences, setting the foundation for a lifetime of good oral health.


As a Pediatric Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in providing support to our pediatric dentist and ensuring that each child's visit is smooth and enjoyable. Your responsibilities will include:

* Assisting the pediatric dentist during dental procedures, including examinations, cleanings, and treatments.
* Preparing treatment rooms and ensuring they are well-stocked and sanitized.
* Welcoming young patients and their families, helping to create a friendly and reassuring atmosphere.
* Educating children and their parents on proper oral hygiene techniques.
* Taking digital X-rays and maintaining accurate patient records.
* Sterilizing and maintaining dental instruments and equipment.
* Providing chairside assistance to the dentist, anticipating their needs and ensuring patient comfort.
* Offering support to children who may be anxious or nervous about dental procedures.
* Adhering to infection control protocols and maintaining a safe environment for patients and staff.
* Participating in team meetings and continuing education opportunities to stay up-to-date with best practices.

  


**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of an accredited dental assisting program.
* Pediatric dental experience is preferred but not required; willingness to learn and work with children is essential.
* X-ray certification.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially when interacting with children and parents.
* Organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.

  


**Benefits:** We offer a competitive compensation package along with the following benefits:

* Salary: starting at $20 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday

title: Orthodontic Assistant - Queens Based
description:
At NYFD, we are a trailblazing company at the forefront of dentistry. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work culture, encouraging fresh ideas and empowering our employees to achieve their full potential. As an orthodontic assistant you will play a pivotal role in driving our continued success. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the organizational workflow and work alongside a team of talented professionals who are dedicated to pushing boundaries and delivering exceptional results.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* taking their medical history, explaining the treatment process, and addressing any concerns or questions they may have.
* assist the orthodontist during procedures by providing instruments, materials, and equipment required for the treatment. They should also ensure the patient's comfort and safety throughout the procedure.
* taking dental X-rays and impressions of patients' teeth. They should be proficient in operating X-ray machines, following safety protocols, and ensuring accurate and clear images.
* should adhere to strict infection control protocols, sterilize instruments, clean treatment areas, and maintain a safe and hygienic working environment.
* should maintain patient records, update treatment progress notes, and document any necessary information related to the procedures performed.
* educate patients on proper oral hygiene practices, including brushing, flossing, and caring for their orthodontic appliances. They should also provide instructions on the use of orthodontic appliances and answer any questions related to treatment.

  


**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

**Meaningful Impact:** Be part of a company that is transforming dentistry.


**Innovative Environment:** Work with cutting-edge technology and collaborate with industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions.


**Growth Opportunities:** We invest in our employees' professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.


**Collaborative Culture:** Join a diverse, welcoming and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity, and open communication.

* Team celebrations and quarterly meetings

**Competitive Compensation and Benefits:** We offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work.️

* Salary: starting at $20-26 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday
  




**Requirements:**


To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* CPR or X Ray certification
* Completion of a dental assistant program or equivalent training
* Experience working in an orthodontic or dental office

title: Dental Receptionist
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional patient hospitality and making a positive impact on people's lives? New York Family Dentistry (NYFD) is excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Dental Receptionist to join our family-oriented team.


At NYFD, we prioritize creating lifelong positive experiences for our patients while fostering a supportive, engaging, and collaborative work environment.

**Why join us as a Dental Receptionist**

**Patient Hospitality:** Make a difference in patients' lives by providing a warm, welcoming, and positive experience from the moment they walk through our doors.

**Family Work Environment:** Be part of a close-knit team that values collaboration, support, and mutual respect.

**Competitive Compensation** Base per hour plus bonus opportunities.

**Career Growth**: Gain opportunities to grow your skills and advance your career in the dental field.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Warm Welcome:** Greet patients warmly and ensure they feel valued from their first interaction.

**Patient Support:** Assist patients in completing essential documentation, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

**Scheduling Excellence** Manage appointment scheduling, adapt to rescheduling or cancellations, and maintain an organized schedule for our dental team.

**Effective Communication**: Communicate professionally, respectfully, and courteously with patients and colleagues, embodying our esteemed practice's essence.

**Professional Appearance:** Maintain a neat and professional appearance, reflecting our company's positive image.


**What We Offer**

**Impactful Role:** Join a company transforming the field of dentistry, where your role will make a significant difference.

**Innovative Environment:** Thrive in an environment where cutting-edge technology is the norm and collaborate with industry experts to pioneer groundbreaking solutions.

**Career Development:** We are dedicated to nurturing your growth with tailored opportunities for advancement and learning.

**Team Spirit:** Enjoy the camaraderie of a dedicated team and partake in spirited quarterly meetings, where your expertise will be appreciated and celebrated.

**Requirements:**

  

* Previous Medical/Dental Reception experience, focusing on patient hospitality.
* Experience with Dental Office Software is a plus (Dentrix, Ascend, Eagle Soft)
* Knowledge of Dental terminology and procedures
* Knowledge of Dental Insurances; PPO, HMO, DHMO, Managed Care
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Fluent in English; Bilingual skills, proficiency in Spanish is preferred and considered a valuable asset.

  

Salary: starting at $18 per hour depending on experience



Join us at New York Family Dentistry and become part of a dynamic team that values your experience and offers opportunities for personal and professional growth. Apply now to embark on the next step in your career!

title: Platform Partnerships Director
description:
**ROLE: Platform Partnerships Director**

**LOCATION: New York**

**SALARY: $100,000 - $120,000 + bonus**

**Who are we?**


We are the originators of influencer marketing.


Influencer is an agency built at the intersection of creativity, data, and technology with a unique ‘people power & platform power’ approach.


From big brand launches to shifting perceptions and from riding fast trends to driving footfall, Influencer builds ideas with impact to deliver outcomes that drive your business forward via an unmatched client experience.


Campaigns are underpinned by Influencer’s game-changing proprietary technologies, which are supercharged by official partnerships and data integrations with the world’s leading social platforms for real-time and accurate reporting. Influencer is an Official Global Marketing Partner of both TikTok and Meta.


We believe the more tangible, scaled outcomes that creators produce drive impact beyond just likes and impressions. Influencer is championing the ‘True Human Influence’ movement; on a mission for creator campaigns to be judged in the same way as other media activations - underpinned by measurement partners such as ThisThat, Neilsen, and Relative Insight.


Founded by OG YouTube creator Caspar Lee & entrepreneur Ben Jeffries, Influencer has been helping brands navigate the ever-evolving influencer marketing landscape since 2015. In that time they have developed valuable knowledge, experience, and technology that have enabled them to deliver thousands of campaigns, for hundreds of brands in markets across the world. Today, Influencer has a team of 120+ of the best talent in the industry, working across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. From Google to Coca-Cola, from Amazon to Microsoft, and from TikTok to Meta - they work with companies, brands, and agencies across every vertical, building meaningful relationships between brands, creators, and their audiences.

**Description**


As the Platform Partnerships Director, you will support in maintaining partnerships status with existing platform partnerships and onboarding of partnerships status with new platforms. You will find and drive revenue opportunities from new and existing platform partners, support the business internally from an operations perspective while converting partnership clients into key accounts.


Key Responsibilities:

* Manage existing relationships with platform partners at TikTok, Meta, YouTube, Snap and more, serving as the main point of contact between each platform and the agency.
* Build relationships with all platforms to grow a pipeline of potential new partnerships beneficial to the agency’s growth and offerings.
* Ensure all criteria for our ‘badged’ status with each of our partners are met with a focus on maintaining a strong working relationship.
* Alongside sales lead, track revenue for each platform partner and report on progress to the VP of Sales and Group Director of Client Services.
* Support a verticalized Sales team with new opportunities and relationship management across all platform partners.
* Educate the US team on partnership, process or innovation changes occurring with our partners through educational sessions, specific decks to support the relationships and platform narratives, and more.
* Partner cross functionally in pre and post sale to ensure platform partner insights are up to date, support on product questions, invoicing, and overall feedback on partnership opportunities.
* Provide regular market feedback to our product and marketing teams to aid in the development of our offering and to ensure alignment with our platform partnerships.
* Oversee development of all platform partner case studies which includes partnering with client services to receive reporting data and work with design to ensure completion.


Requirements:

* 5+ years of experience at an agency or platform.
* Ability to be a self starter and to take control of opportunities with strong revenue skills, with an understanding of targets and how to execute against them.
* Understanding of platform products, data, and implementation, with the ability to act as an key stakeholder internally and externally, overseeing all capabilities and best practices related to product.
* Skilled in client relationship strategy and management, with a proven track record of delivering on client needs via innovative solutions.
* Excellent proposal and presentation skills, with the ability to present to both internal and external stakeholders.
* Extensive knowledge of the broader competitive landscape, capable of staying on top of relevant market trends and platform updates.

**(some of our) Benefits & Perks:**

  

* 401k Plan (eligible after your first 90 days of employment)
* Medical, Dental & Vision plans provided
* 22 days of Paid Time Off (+ US Holidays which can be flexed to your needs)
* Office first hybrid approach with 3 days in our NY HQ (Nomad)
* Career Framework approach to leveling to ensure our compensation and progression is competitive
* Yearly tenure celebrations
* Company wide offsites, seasonal celebrations and events


At Influencer, we’re committed to cultivating an environment that promotes diversity, equity and inclusion. We promote DEI in our workplace and are a global community who believe our unique qualities should be celebrated. We want everyone at Influencer to bring their authentic selves to work everyday, irrespective of age, disability (including hidden disabilities), gender, gender identity or gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is embedded into everything we do at Influencer and is a part of our culture. All we ask is that you have a passion for Influencer Marketing and a desire to be a part of one of the fastest growing companies within this exciting industry.

title: Patient Care Caller
description:
**Patient Care Caller**


Are you an organized, adaptable, and experienced communicator ready to make a difference in patient care? Join our team across five practices in Brooklyn and Queens as a Patient Care Caller.

**Responsibilities:**

* Reach out to patients via phone calls to follow up on their recent medical appointments or treatments.
* Listen attentively to patients' concerns, questions, and feedback regarding their care experience.
* Provide empathetic and knowledgeable responses to address patients' inquiries or escalate issues to appropriate personnel for resolution.
* Accurately and thoroughly document all interactions with patients in our database or electronic medical records system.
* Ensure compliance with all patient privacy and confidentiality regulations (e.g., HIPAA) during interactions.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on healthcare procedures, policies, and best practices.
* Maintain a positive and supportive attitude towards patients, colleagues, and healthcare professionals.

  


**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in healthcare or customer service is a plus.
* Proven experience in a customer service or patient care role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, conveying empathy and professionalism over the phone.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with patients from diverse backgrounds.
* Detail-oriented and organized, with multitasking and prioritization abilities.
* Proficiency in using computers and electronic medical records systems; familiarity with CRM software is advantageous.
* Ability to remain calm and composed in challenging or emotional situations.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining patient confidentiality.
* Flexibility to work shifts that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays based on operational needs.


Salary: $30,000-300,000

description:

title: Assistant General Manager (AGM)
description:
STK Steakhouse is the global leader in Vibe Dining. With energetic, high-end restaurants and bars in cities like Las Vegas, New York, Miami, London, and many more we take pride in our ability to execute an unforgettable experience for our guests no matter the occasion!


Apply now to join the world of VIBE DINING as a key part of the guest experience!


We are always looking for individuals that are looking to Grow and Develop as new opportunities continue to be available in this expanding company.

**Job description**


We strive for a premier culture that encompasses teamwork, collaboration, and values. There is a passion in everything we do, and we are looking for people with similar attributes. Get started on a career path as we are always looking for individuals that are looking to grow and develop as new opportunities continue to be available in this expanding company.


ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER (AGM) POSITION OVERVIEW:


The Assistant General Manager with The ONE Group is responsible for leading, educating, motivating and energizing the team to be the BEST restaurant in every market we operate by delivering exceptional and unforgettable guest experiences to every guest every time!


This position is also responsible for the entire operation and financial performance of the restaurant and/or outlets. The AGM must be able to clearly distill information to staff and Director of Operations.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


Operations Management

* Manage, lead and mentor Managers and Staff
* Ensure service is maintained at the utmost of quality levels through proper execution of the sequence of service and high energy
* Maintain overall vision – business and marketing objectives
* Develop risk management and mitigation strategies
* Represent The ONE Group in investigating, answering, and settling grievances
* Maintain all corporate mandates
* Update and track daily reports

Staffing and Team Development

* Analyze staffing requirements, develop iteration plans, and assess opportunities for future growth
* Interview, screen, and recruit job applicants
* Coach, train and develop management and hourly staff
* Responsible for Team performance – morale, productivity, energy
* Manage regular review of performance for Management and Hourly staff within the Performance Management guidelines
* Demonstrate a positive example. No consumption of alcohol

Fiscal Responsibility

* Monitor activities and expenses
* Set and monitor sales forecasts and profitability reports
* Keep Director of Operations informed of sales and key issues
* Increasing sales through marketing, networking and incentives for staff to raise guest check average
* Maintains budgeted revenues, cost of sales (COS), labor, supplies and operating cash flow (OCF).
* Reviews monthly profit and loss statement and acts on all variances
* Have oversight of the beverage program and liaise with Beverage Director on all changes, mandates and controls of beverage costs

Marketing & Guest Relations

* Develops new marketing ideas and concepts with Marketing team
* Maintain relationships with “regulars”, VIPs, influencers and key people in the industry

QUALIFICATIONS/PRIMARY JOB REQUIREMENTS:

* Minimum 5 years professional hospitality experience; ideally in venues exceeding $7 million
* Expert knowledge of all Restaurant computer systems
* Excellent management, delegation and presentation skills
* Strong influence, interpersonal, leadership, managerial, communication, problem solving and creative solution generation skills
* A strong financial acumen and proven ability to successful manage budgets and P&L

The company offer the following Insurance benefits to all **full time and variable benefit eligible** employees (waiting period applies)

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Group Life and Disability
* Group Accident Insurance
* Group Hospital Indemnity Insurance
* Group Critical Illness Insurance


The company offer the following benefits to **all employees** regardless of position or status

* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Dependent Care Benefit
* Employee Dining Discounts and/or complementary meals onsite
* Traditional and Roth 401K Plan
* Commuter Benefits
* Paid Sick Time Off

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


Receives written work orders or verbal instructions from supervisor.


Assists in communication with residents, if necessary, regarding work tickets or needed repairs.


Prepare apartments for change in occupancy, which may include painting, cleaning, and delivering appliances.


Cleans internal areas of the community, including dusting, sweeping, and mopping of the clubhouse, offices, model apartments, and amenities.


Maintains grounds by picking up trash and cleaning common areas.


Empties trash cans and consolidates trash for weekly pickup.


Must possess basic knowledge of hand tools.


Operate snow removal equipment and shovel snow to maintain parking lots and sidewalks.


Assists other departments with moving furniture, appliances, and unloading and storing appliances.


Light electrical (replacing light bulbs and sockets).


Conduct general upkeep procedures (e.g. landscaping) and other tasks as assigned (painting, carpentry, etc.).


After-hours on-call availability, overtime, and weekend availability.


Performs other related duties as assigned by management.


HVAC experience is a plus.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**


High school diploma or general education degree (GED), or three to six months related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.


Computer skills required: Microsoft Word & Excel, Outlook


Other skills required: Carpentry, appliance repair, plumbing experience, minor electrical experience, knowledge of painting, sheetrock repair, etc.  



  

**COMPETENCIES:**

**Problem-Solving** - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem-solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.

**Cost Consciousness** - Conserves organizational resources.

**Planning/Organizing** - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans.

**Professionalism** - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.

**Adaptability** - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

**Dependability** - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.

**Diversity** - Demonstrates knowledge of EEO policy; Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; Educates others on the value of diversity; Promotes a harassment-free environment; Builds a diverse workforce.

**Ethics** - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Inspires the trust of others; Works with integrity and ethics; Upholds organizational values.

**Safety and Security** - Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly

 **PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:**


Continually required to stand


Continually required to walk


Occasionally required to sit


Continually required to utilize hand and finger dexterity


Frequently required to climb, balance


Frequently required to bend, stoop, kneel, or crawl


Occasionally exposure to wet and/or humid conditions (non-weather)


Occasionally work near moving mechanical parts


Occasionally exposure to outside weather conditions


While performing the duties of this job, the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.


The employee must occasionally lift and /or move more than 50 pounds / frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds / continually lift and/or move up to 10 pounds


Specific vision abilities required by this job include: Close vision; Distance vision; Color vision; Peripheral vision; Depth perception and the ability to adjust focus


Specialized equipment, machines, or vehicles used: A valid and Clean Driver's license is required to drive company trucks and/or golf carts.

title: Post-Harvest Associate
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**


The Post-Harvest Associate will be responsible for preparing and processing harvests for flower sales and oil extraction. The Post-Harvest Associate will also be responsible for equipment sanitization and sterilization as well as maintaining facilities cleanliness.

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITES**

* Manicuring cannabis in preparation for packaging Accurately weigh and record post-harvest material sand cannabis products
* Follow Standard Operating procedures for debucking, trimming, grinding, drying, and curing cannabis harvests in preparation for oil extraction and/or flower sales
* Maintain a neat and organized work area allowing for the proper segregation of materials and processes
* Precise hand trimming will be required for flower sales
* Responsible for facility and equipment cleaning in a clean room manufacturing environment to maintain required standards
* Responsible for organizing work areas and performing daily tasks such as washing and sanitizing equipment and racking systems Responsible for weighing, filling, and packaging work related to flower products using aseptic technic so that no contamination is introduced into the process or material
* Sanitization and sterilization of post-harvest processing equipment such as stainless-steel racks and shelves
* Routine and real time visual quality inspection of cannabis products for correct product consistency while trimming
* Accurately weigh/count and record cannabis products
* Comply with all applicable government regulations and Company policies and procedures, including sanitation, security, workplace safety, and confidentiality, among others
* Participate in upfront and ongoing training to master skills needed to complete relevant tasks
* Identify and communicate issues and assist in troubleshooting, identifying potential solutions, and in implementing and monitoring corrective actions
* Help prepare for audits and assist state and local governmental auditors and law enforcement with their audits as needed
* Track data to comply with applicable rules and to support management decision-making
* Contribute ideas to help improve Company's choices for ingredients, equipment and methodologies, policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and training materials
* Strict adherence to procedures and practices according to internal SOP and state regulation
* Strong emphasis on documentation according to state regulations
* Adhere to the departmental, site and safety policies
**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

* Well organized and ability to keep deadlines
* Works well with all peers
* Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing, and challenging environment
* Basic Excel, Word, and general compute knowledge
* Fast, efficient, nimble.
* Experience working in a shifting environment with a great deal of constructive feedback and input
* Must be 21 years or older and pass any and all required pre-employment screenings
* Full knowledge of all applicable law, regulations, and requirements to keep the facility at 100% compliance at all times, this includes being up to date on any changes to current applicable laws/regulations
* Must be and remain compliant with any and all regulatory requirements for working in the cannabis industry
* Must be able to obtain and retain a Registered Agent Card issued by the state of operation
* Must have excellent organization and time management skills
* Must be focused, pay close attention to detail
* Must be able to internalize training and follow instructions
* Must be able to communicate clearly and effectively
* Other duties and responsibilities

**COMPANY OVERVIEW**

**Ascend Wellness Holdings (AWH)** is a vertically integrated cannabis cultivator, processor and provisioning center operator with assets in Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, Ohio and Pennsylvania. We seek to foster a robust and inclusive cannabis industry through a premium, unmatched customer-focused retail experience. We are looking to build a world-class team that will help carry out our mission of helping to shape the future of cannabis as a leading healthcare solution. We are committed to improving the quality of our patient's lives by offering unrivaled quality, consistency and meticulously curated products that satisfy our customers unique, individual needs. When it comes to customer service experience, our dispensaries will set a new standard of excellence, emphasizing health and wellness by a highly knowledgeable team. A team that is committed to our values, our people, and our communities; we are looking for people who are inspired by our vision and stay dedicated to our mission as we continuously expand.

**EEO STATEMENT**


Ascend Wellness Holdings, LLC and its subsidiaries is an equal opportunity employer and celebrate the population of differences and does not discriminate in its hiring / hiring practices, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Medical Coding Specialist
description:
**Certified Medical Coding Specialist**


As our certified medical coder, you'll play a vital role in ensuring accurate and efficient coding for both professional and facility claims. You'll review and audit provider notes, ensuring everything aligns with regulations. You'll also have the chance to help shape our billing rules and be part of a friendly, supportive team. We offer a welcoming environment with plenty of training opportunities, tools for your success, and room for professional growth. Join us and make a meaningful impact!

**If you are the Certified Professional Coder we are looking for, you will**

* Review and audit medical records to accurately code care
* Utilize available skills and coding resources to determine appropriate ICD-10-CM, CPT and/or HCPCS including specialty specific codes.
* Analyze medical records and provide feedback for any areas of documentation improvement.
* Be professional, enthusiastic and conscientious.
* Apply the technology, analytical, billing and coding expertise you currently have and develop new skills.
* Look forward to growing professionally with advancement opportunities.
* Like collaborating with patients, physicians, and other team members.
* Possess strong communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.
* Be viewed by others as dependable, punctual and honest.

**Experience & Education Requirements**

* Proficient in ICD-10 CM, CPT, HCPCS
* Strong Medical Terminology and Anatomy understanding
* Coding certification required (CPC, CIC, CCA, CCA ) - CPC preferred
* CPMA, CASCC certification, preferred
* Must have Coding experience in any or all of the following specialities:
	+ Ambulatory Surgery Center
	+ General Orthopedics
	+ Spinal Surgery
	+ Orthopedic Surgery
	+ Pain Management
	+ Vascular Surgery

**Job Type: Full-time**

**Work Location: Hybrid/Remote -** \\*\\*This position offers the flexibility for a hybrid/remote arrangement, contingent upon the candidate's proximity to our headquarters in New Jersey.\\*\\*

description:

* Post and analyze insurance and patient payments to proper line items while validating correct payments are issued using appropriate fee schedules for reference.
* Have a strong understanding of Out-Of-Network benefits and how the reimbursements relate to CMS, UCR, Reasonable & Customary, NJ PIP and Fair Health fee schedules.
* Have a keen eye and ability to see trends in denials and payments to help close the gap with documentation and collections
* Retrieve insurance Remittance Advice notices and Explanation of Benefits for proper handling
* Be well spoken and articulate as this position requires a high volume of communication with insurances, legal offices, providers and patients as well as other staff.
* Be professional, enthusiastic, conscientious, and possess strong communication, organization, and problem-solving skills.
* Enjoy collaborating with patients, physicians, and other team members.
* Look forward to growing professionally with advancement opportunities.
* Be viewed by others as dependable, punctual and honest.

**Experience & Education Requirements**

* Required: 2 years medical payment posting experience in electronic and paper remittances for all payer types
* Required: Proficiency with electronic health records and other programs used in medical billing (ex. Navinet, Availity, and Payer Portals)
* Required: Strong understanding of insurance benefits (deductibles, co-insurances, copays, and out of pocket expenses)
* Required: Knowledge of CPT, ICD-10 codes, modifiers, and HIPAA
* Preferred: CareCloud experience

**Salary commensurate on experience**

**Benefits offered:**

* Paid time off
* Health insurance
* Supplemental insurance - AFLAC
* Paid holidays
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Work Remotely:

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
The Marketing Coordinator serves as one of the motivated, high-energy faces of the organization! They are
  

imperative to the coordination of both internal and external marketing initiatives. This role is responsible for
  

connecting the community by cultivating relationships with the community and other relevant organizations
  

through digital outlets, social media and more. The Marketing Coordinator will work in conjunction with the
  

marketing department to elevate digital marketing and community engagement.


**Role and Responsibilities**

**Events:**  

* Coordinate calendar of outreach activities, including community events, workshops,

sponsorships, appearances, and other communication activities.
  

* Schedule regular outreach exhibitions in the community and educate employees on

community responsibilities.
  

* Seek out, schedule, coordinate and execute community sponsorships including sports,

municipalities, schools, etc.
  

* Seek out, coordinate and execute Teacher Wellness Days - including catering lunch, scheduling

providers for individual schools and serving the community with our services.
  

* Manage inventory of promotional items for events.
* Maintain communication with internal team members and clinical directors on staffing needs,

upcoming events and more.
  

* Assist in the organization of special events, including fundraising and conference initiatives.
* Support the administrative staff by providing marketing related data, trends, forecasts, and new

patient information.
  

* Maximize marketing experience and company education by participating in outbound

opportunities.
  

* Work directly with graphic design, business development and other teams to build and

streamline projects, including due dates, follow ups, and more.
  

* Maintain constant contact and relationships with multiple outsourced vendors.
* Maintain an "event ready" standard by keeping promotional material coordinated as well as

communicating the need for additional inventory including giveaways and promotional materials
  

* Coordinate event assembly and set up standard/ requirement for outreach events
* Develop and manage marketing calendar to be used as a departmental tool for assigning and

coordinating event schedules within the marketing team
  

* Prepare and distribute post-event summary and analytics, including but not limited to, number

of leads captured and results from follow up
  

* Direct report to the Director of Marketing regarding internal and external efforts Facilitate the

acquisition of new marketing opportunities
  

  

**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's degree in relevant focus
* Must have experience in Microsoft Suites
* Outstanding written communication and presentation skills
* Ability to handle and transport event supplies and equipment
* Friendly, enthusiastic and positive attitude
* Strong knowledge of social media and marketing mediums and platforms
* Detail- oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects at a time
* Must be able and willing to drive personal vehicle for work purposes

title: Janitor - Custodian
description:
Are you looking to make a difference while building a career in a laid-back yet growth-oriented environment? At **Paramount Services Group Inc.**, we're committed to providing top-notch commercial janitorial services and maintenance to our clients in the Wassaic, Amenia, Red Hook, Kingston, Milton, Pawling, Pawling, Brewster, or Millbrook areas.


We want you to be a part of our success! We are looking for a **Janitor - Custodian** to join our cleaning team! This janitorial services position enjoys a **pay range of $16.00 - $20.70+ per hour (based on your experience and location)**, plus **opportunities for growth** and **a great work atmosphere**, this **full-time position** in **Augusta, NJ**, offers more than just a job-it's a pathway to a fulfilling career.

 **ABOUT OUR COMPANY**


Headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, Paramount Services Group Inc. offers professional maintenance, pest control, janitorial, and landscaping services. From medical facilities to daycare centers, we keep buildings and grounds in tip-top shape year-round. Our clients appreciate our commitment to delivering excellent results at competitive prices. At Paramount Services Group Inc., we don't just do the job faster-we also do it better!


We're proud to be an inclusive, diverse company with a supportive working environment. We've learned that when every employee is treated with respect, they pull together to become an engaged, harmonious team. That's why we facilitate a **laid-back, collegial atmosphere** and provide our staff with **flexibility and growth opportunities**. If this sounds like a company you want to be a part of, connect with us today!

 **WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU**

* 2+ years of commercial cleaning experience (required)
* Proficiency in English (strongly preferred)

 **WHAT YOUR ROLE ENTAILS**


As a Janitor - Custodian, your day is all about keeping the spaces we serve spotless and welcoming. You start your day by gathering your cleaning supplies-water, chemicals, and disinfectants-to sanitize surfaces, ensuring every office space and common area is clean and inviting. You thoroughly vacuum floors, empty wastebaskets, and replace liners. Keeping restrooms stocked with paper products and removing trash and recyclables is all in a day's work. Each day presents a chance to make a visible impact and take pride in the cleanliness and order you create.

 **WORK SCHEDULE**


This full-time janitorial services position is based in Augusta, NJ, with schedules that may vary depending on the job location.

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR CLEANING TEAM?**


If you're ready to step into a janitorial services role where your hard work is recognized and rewarded, we're eager to hear from you! Applying is quick and easy-our initial application takes just 3 minutes on your mobile device. Start your journey with Paramount Services Group Inc. as our new Janitor - Custodian today, and let's achieve great things together!

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Homeless Solutions has been a leader in providing affordable housing, outreach support and resources to Morris County, NJ for over 40 years. The role of **Maintenance Technician** at HSI is an opportunity to join our team of housing professionals, supporting the day to day facility operations for 140 units of Homeless Solutions (HSI) owned or managed permanent residential properties. **Join our team in providing a tangible positive impact to the lives of our clients and tenants!**


This is a full time, non- exempt, onsite position, reporting to the Lead Maintenance Technician, with travel to our other facilities primarily in the Morris County area. This position is responsible for implementing our high standards for the maintenance and upkeep of our growing property portfolio, and for imparting that philosophy on tenants and those who work for or contract with HSI. Flexibility of schedule to allow for a collaborative approach to emergency services is required. Position is offered at a starting pay rate of $20-$21/hr.


All applications must be made through the following link:

**https://homelesssolutions.applicantpro.com/jobs/**


This role will be responsible for oversight of and participation in activities including:

* Typical repair tasks relate to basic carpentry, drywall/tape/spackle, paint, flooring and tile, electrical (i.e. light fixture changes), and plumbing (i.e. sink faucet changes, leak repair) as well as routine and preventative maintenance on HVAC units. Supplementary groundskeeping work as necessary.
* Installing and servicing kitchen equipment, appliances, window air conditioning units, etc.
* Moving equipment and furniture for all HSI facilities and sites.
* Assist with necessary renovations and cleaning of tenant units upon move out.
* Respond to off -hour facility emergencies as necessary

 **Qualifications**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Sufficient experience to provide for common working knowledge and with construction means and methods.
* Knowledge of safety practices and procedures related to the building trades and maintaining a safe working environment.
* Functional working knowledge and ability of computing systems and software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* Physically capable of performing duties and responsibilities mentioned herein (to include lifting and carrying objects up to 50 lbs.). Able to sit, stand, walk, kneel, climb and navigate stairs and uneven terrain at properties.
* Must have and maintain a valid driver's license with a clean driving record.


Full time permanent staff of Homeless Solutions are eligible to enroll in **fully paid medical,** dental and life insurance coverage plans in accordance with HSI policies. In addition, all staff are eligible immediately upon hiring to participate in a **401k retirement savings plan, including up to a 6% company paid match**. Generous PTO plans include paid personal, vacation and sick leave as well as 10 floating holidays annually.


HSI is an equal opportunity employer, and we appreciate and celebrate the diversity of our staff. We believe that diversity not only includes race and gender, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of an individual's identity. HSI recruits, hires, trains, promotes, compensates and administers all policy and actions with equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. The points of view of all of our staff are important, and supporting a culture of inclusion is everyone's responsibility.

title: Social Worker- Care Manager MLTC
description:
**Social Work Care Manager**


VillageCareMAX


\\*Full Time - Remote Opportunity\\*


VillageCare is looking for a self-motivated and passionate Social Worker Care Manager, who will provide telephonic assessments of member's status and needs. This position works with our patients to develop, implement, and monitor their care plan and ensure continuity of care while monitoring long term care needs. Some daily activities will include:

* Providing all aspects of care management such as planning, coordination, assessment of health, environmental, and psychosocial status of the members on an ongoing basis.
* Identify health, environmental, and psychosocial risks for assigned members and recommend appropriate interventions.
* Provide an on-going assessment of the effectiveness of the Member's plan of care.

* Make requests for authorization to the Care Management Supervisor for new services and changes to the plan of care.
* Assist, as needed, in the semi-annual reassessments using the New York State designated assessment tool and other plan defined assessment tools.

**We would like to speak to those who Minimum formal education of Master's Degree and a current NYS LMSW license. Minimum of one (1) year job-related experience in MLTC. Bilingual skills highly preferred.**

There are many benefits to working for VillageCare. If you are someone who likes being part of a team, enjoys a highly competitive benefits package from work leading carries and competitive compensation than we would love to speak with you!


* PTO package, 10 Paid Holidays, Personal and Sick time, Medical/Dental/Vision, HRA/FSA, Education Reimbursement, Retirement Savings 403(b), Life & Disability, Commuter Benefits, Paid Family Leave, Additional Employee Discounts

We are committed to superior outcomes in quality health care.*

title: Mavis Tire - Tax Analyst, Tax + Treasury
description:
**Mavis Tire - Tax Analyst, Tax + Treasury**


Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full time Tax Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Corporate Offices in White Plains, NY. With over 2,000 retail locations, Mavis is one of the largest tire sales and automotive repair chains in the United States, and we're growing rapidly.


#ZR

**Position Summary and Responsibilities**

Your primary responsibilities include working with internal and external partners to ensure all sales and use tax compliance, audit, and accounting obligations are completed. Success in this role will require a passion for identifying and driving process improvements, enthusiasm for leading change, and a low tolerance for the status quo.


Apply sales and use taxation knowledge to analyze and determine the applicability of sales & use tax on business purchases and ensure correct general ledger classification for enterprise-wide purchasing activity. Manage vendor questions for resale certificates and related processes.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree required, in Accounting or Finance
* 2+ years of Sales and Use Tax experience (public or private)
* Strong organization and time management attributes with ability to handle multiple priorities
* Experience working independently in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities
* Knowledge and ability to learn of current state and local (multi-jurisdictional) sales/use tax laws, concepts, policies, and regulations and the specific application of these to retail companies
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office computer software applications; strong expertise in Excel required
* Microsoft Dynamics 365 experience a plus
* Experience and ability to respond to customers' sales tax questions (includes ability to perform tax research and provide taxability guidance)
* Ability to communicate clearly, accurately, and tactfully, both verbally and in writing, successfully translating always-complex tax rules for business partners and customers.

**Essential Functions of the Position**

* Responsible for the exemption/resale certificate process
* Collaborate with team members on providing appropriate exemptions and resale certificates to vendors and suppliers and respond to related inquiries
* Manage issuance of tax exemption certificates
* Register in new jurisdictions for sales/use tax purposes as needed
* Research and respond to sales/use tax questions submitted by internal and external customers, including responding in a timely, accurate, and complete fashion
* Provide guidance regarding taxability of products and services
* Provide support for D365 to ensure proper taxation
* Assist in audit defense efforts as needed
* Assist in reconciliation of sales/use tax workpapers including sales/use tax accounts
* Assist in the management of the monthly sales tax compliance process with outside service provider, ensuring accuracy and completeness
* Assist in the management of the indirect tax general ledger accounts and monthly tax reconciliations
* Respond to indirect tax notices and support indirect tax audits inquiries
* Assist with additional projects and assignments, including business registrations, trade name/DBA filings and annual reports, as required
* Prepare, file, and submit payment for various miscellaneous tax returns as needed
* Maintain the tax department's indirect tax filing calendar
* Maintain and update monthly process documentations as needed
* Recommend process improvement to elevate accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency
* Perform tax research using available research tools
* Contribute insights to the development of automated solutions to support our compliance process and tax-related systems
* Communicate effectively with team members and customers to provide exceptional service and support

**Employee Benefits**


At Mavis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, including weekly incentive compensation, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid sick and personal time, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

***Mavis is an Equal Opportunity Employer***

*Consistent with our commitment to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all individuals, we enforce a zero tolerance policy on discrimination at Mavis. Employment decisions are made without regard to an applicant's or employee's actual or perceived membership in any category or status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. Where appropriate, Mavis may provide reasonable accommodation, in order for an otherwise qualified individual to perform the essential functions of the position.*

*Mavis does not seek salary history information from applicants.*
company_description: Mavis Discount Tire is one of the largest independent automotive platforms in the United States.

title: Global Security Operations Manager (GSOC)
description:
**Global Security Operations Manager (GSOC)**

  

Salary: $110,000 - $120,000, Full-time

 **BENEFITS**

* Paid Time Off ( PTO)
* Medical Plan
* Vision Plan
* Dental Plan
* 401 K
* Life Insurance
* Career Development Opportunities
* Referral Bonuses


Doyle Security Services is currently recruiting for a Global Security Operations Center (GSOC) Manager. In this role you will be responsible for building a 24/7/365 GSOC for a multinational media client and managing a team of operators that must assess domestic and international risk to the firm's buildings, events, and operations, provide duty of care support for the firm's journalists and business travelers, lead firm-wide crisis management, and operate all company access control and video monitoring systems.

 **You have**:

  

* A bachelor's degree, with at least five (5) years' experience managing a fast paced, high pressure, and multicultural GSOC environment with multiple personnel and multiple sites. Fluent in English, with Spanish language a plus.
* Extensive program management, process development, and governance experience, a strong security and intelligence analysis background, and the ability to drive change, leading improvement and innovation at scale across an organization.
* A growth and solutions oriented mindset.
* The ability to couple self-motivated initiative with good judgment, collaboration, and strong upward communication skills to internal and external client stakeholders.
* Proven ability to plan for and effectively manage change - processes, policies, and/or technology.
* Demonstrated comfort with technology, with the ability to quickly navigate and oversee the use of multiple systems, databases, and applications. Experience with C-Cure 9000 required; visitor management systems, and/or ServiceNow applications a plus.
* Excellent oral and written communications skills - briefing senior client representatives and the ability to develop written security and intelligence products is a must.
* Strong experience in people management, including proven ability to manage conflict successfully and experience gathering and analyzing data to create metrics that support continuous program improvement.

 **You will**:

  

* Build out the client's strategic vision for the GSOC through process, procedure and policy development, accountability and responsibility frameworks, and performance and auditing metrics to meet client KPIs and SLAs.
* Design and implement overarching global governance structures which ensure globally consistent standards across our operations center, while also devolving authority and responsibility regionally/locally as appropriate.
* Develop a GSOC-led intelligence and crisis management program for the firm.
* Manage the day-to-day personnel operations of the GSOC, serving as the primary client contact for operational escalations and concerns.
* Establish and maintain the training of the GSOC operator staff, including developing a program to foster their professional advancement.
* Ensure appropriate staffing coverage and responsibilities across shifts, to include implementing contingency plans to prevent gaps in service deliverables and operational standards.
* Succinctly articulate, communicate, and follow up on reported incidents in a timely manner and thoroughly troubleshoot technology issues.
* Regularly attend client meetings to report on contractual and operational KPIs and SLAs involving the team's performance and service delivery for each of the three GSOC work streams (intelligence analysis, travel and crisis management, and access control).
* Be on-site in the GSOC Monday-Friday. You must also be available to support as needed after hours, weekends, and holidays for urgent escalations.

  

Doyle Security Services, Inc. is committed to providing exceptional services and solutions to our clients and need your extraordinary work ethic to do so!

**EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability** Doyle Security Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

title: Human Resources Director
description:
**The Company**


Friedman Vartolo LLP is a rapidly growing New York based real estate and default services law firm with 200+ employees across six states. The firm prides itself not solely on its superior legal product, but also on its innovative approach to business and problem solving. We offer a fresh, fast-paced energy, with a startup vibe.

**The Position**


We are seeking an experienced and strategic Human Resources Director to lead our HR department at Friedman Vartolo LLP. The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of HR best practices, particularly within a legal environment, and will be responsible for overseeing all HR functions, including employee relations, performance management, compensation and benefits, and compliance. This role will work closely with senior management to align HR strategies with the firm's business objectives and foster a positive and productive workplace culture.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Address employee concerns and resolve conflicts in a fair and timely manner. Foster a positive workplace culture and ensure adherence to firm policies and procedures.
* Oversee performance evaluation processes, including goal setting, feedback, and development plans.
* Manage compensation structures, salary reviews, and benefit programs.
* Ensure the firm's people practices comply with federal, state, and local labor laws and regulations. Conduct regular audits and updates to maintain compliance.
* Oversee people operations systems and processes, including employee records, HRIS management, and reporting.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Minimum of 8-10 years of HR experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role within a legal or professional services environment.
* Strong knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Proficiency in HRIS systems, Monday.com and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Compensation/Benefits**


We offer a compensation package that will be commensurate with experience and a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, flex spending, 401k and gym/fitness membership reimbursement.

**ADA Compliance**


Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), it is the policy of Friedman Vartolo to provide reasonable accommodations when requested by a qualified applicant or candidate with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship for Friedman Vartolo. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact Recruitment at recruitment@friedmanvartolo.com to request an accommodations.

**Location**


Garden City, NY

title: Director of Systems & IT
description:
**Position Summary**
As Director of Systems and IT, you will support Murray’s Cheese in driving IT strategy, digital transformation, security, and maintenance to support processes and systems across the company. This position supports E-commerce, Omnichannel, Retail Store operations, Inventory management, and warehouse operations, among other primary business units. In addition, daily technical support, such as office, store network, desktop support, and infrastructure services end-to-end, is to be provided.

 **Who You Are**

* **A Team Leader:** You know what each of your team members needs to grow and succeed and are helping them achieve those things.
* **Collaborative:** You manage your time efficiently in order to supportmultiple departments, including e-commerce, Retail, Sales, and Operations, all of which rely heavily on your expertise.
* **User-Sensitive**: You can empathize with end users who may be less technologically competent. You seek to understand their business conditions, designing interfaces that are easy to learn and systematizing processes for easy use.
* **Solution-Driven:** You never apply a temporary fix to a problem and consider it resolved. You always seek sustainable, long-term solutions that will bring the most value to the business. You proactively develop innovative ideas to address challenges, carefully considering how they align with the business's goals before presenting them to senior leadership.

 **What You Do**

* **IT Best Practices**
	+ Ensure high-quality service by creating and enforcing organizational standards.
	+ Develop a system for maintaining corporate hardware and software.
	+ Improve and maintain communication protocols across the company.
	+ Set up a process for updating and backing up the ERP system.
	+ Provide information technology recommendations, policies, and procedures by assessing organizational outcomes, identifying issues, and predicting organizational needs.

* **Cloud/Data Strategy and Transformation**
* Ensure the organization remains effective and efficient by defining, delivering, and supporting strategic plans.
* Provide recommendations for information technology strategies, policies, and procedures by evaluating organizational outcomes, identifying problems, and anticipating organizational requirements.
* Conduct research in emerging technology by studying organizational goals, strategies, practices, projects, and issues.
* Assess our current software and make recommendations for replacements or additional value-added features.

* **Operations and Support**
* Troubleshoot and resolve user issues related to all corporate hardware and software promptly.
* Direct, lead, and mentor IT team members to help them grow their knowledge and project management abilities.
* Take part in all hardware and software evaluations and manage IT vendor contracts and relationships.
* Analyze business needs presented by department heads and suggest technical solutions and project plans.
* Verify application results by conducting system audits of implemented technologies.
* Establish and maintain company-wide security protocols.
* Continue to implement tools to secure the networks and servers
* Organization and management of IT budget

 **What We Need from You**

* Bachelor’s degree (degree in information systems, computer engineering, or computer science is preferred!) or equivalent experience
* 5+ years’ experience in retail and/or restaurant POS software, warehouse management software, or e-commerce
* 5 + years of experience managing a team of reports
* Experience managing an ERP system, preferably NetSuite
* Experience working with and managing outside vendors (MSP)
* Experience or familiarity with Spree, Boomi, or other similar systems
* Knowledge of system fundamentals (system structure, programming, database fundamentals)
* Knowledge of Windows (applications and network configuration)
* Knowledge of current and emerging trends in digital technology
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and effectively prioritize
* Empathetic listening skills and the ability to understand business and other context relevant to shaping our path forward
* Top-notch written and verbal communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate information to all levels within the organization

**Work Perks**

* Weekly pay
* 3 weeks of paid vacation and sick time
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Transit Check commuter benefits
* Discounts on our products and restaurants!

 **E-Verify Notice**

* This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. Please see the attached notice for more information.
* Este empleador participa en E-Verify y proporcionará al gobierno federal la información de su Formulario I-9 para confirmar que usted está autorizado para trabajar en los EE.UU.. Por favor, consulte el aviso adjunto para obtener más información.

title: HS Chemistry and Environmental Science Provider
description:
High School Chemistry and Environmental Science Provider


Are you passionate about teaching and learning? Are you motivated to make a positive impact in the lives of urban, working-class youth? If yes, this position with SmartStart Education is right for you!


About Us:


So, why choose SmartStart Education? SmartStart Education, LLC is an academic solutions company led by experienced educators. We provide educational staffing solutions for grades K-12. SmartStart partners with districts and schools to provide the best education professionals to fill long-term substitute and administrative staff vacancies.


In addition, SmartStart offers comprehensive tutoring programs including in-class, face-to-face high-dosage tutoring to help struggling students close the learning gap.


SmartStart Education also offers the following

* Growth opportunities within the company
* A culture and company built by educators


The Job:


SmartStart Education seeks a science teacher to work with high school students Monday-Friday, teaching Chemistry and Environmental Science. Students are from all grade levels, including 9th 12th Grades. The high school is located in Bronx, NY.


Job Details:


The position begins promptly on September 23, 2024 and ends on April 24, 2025. The schedule will be 8:30 am through 2:50 pm. Applicants are encouraged to schedule interviews as soon as possible to allow ample time to complete onboarding steps. Failure to do so may result in a position being unavailable.


Hiring Process:


As part of our hiring process, we kindly request your adherence to the following steps:

* Timely and transparently respond to the screening questions sent by the Talent Acquisition Manager, ensuring your answers accurately reflect your qualifications and suitability for the position.
* Promptly schedule an interview and demonstrate a commitment to punctuality by attending as scheduled or proactively rescheduling if necessary.
* Participate in a Teamsinterview with a specialized talent acquisition coordinator who will assess your suitability for the role.
* Provide professional references, if applicable, for thorough review and verification of your qualifications and work experience.
* Responsively reply to any extended offer in a timely manner, indicating your acceptance or need for further clarification.
* Complete all onboarding tasks promptly, which may include tasks such as accessing email accounts, providing fingerprints for security purposes, uploading personal information, and completing any required training, as specified.


By meticulously following these steps in a prompt and professional manner, you will contribute to a streamlined and efficient hiring process.


Qualified Candidates:


If you believe that this position aligns with your qualifications and showcases your exceptional skills, we kindly request your confirmation regarding your ability to meet the following minimum requirements:

* Possession of a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in any field is mandatory. \\*\\*\\*Please note that applications with anticipated graduation dates will not be considered.
* Demonstrated experience of at least one year in teaching or tutoring, either within a school environment or another educational setting.
* Comprehensive understanding of the unique challenges faced by urban students, schools, and communities, encompassing racial disparity, socio-economic disparity, and cultural disparity.
* Mastery of secondary science concepts and skills, substantiating proficiency in the subject matter.
* Display of genuine passion and unwavering commitment towards fostering the success of students.
* Bilingual proficiency in Spanish is preferred, although not required.
* Exemplary punctuality, ensuring timely attendance and adherence to established schedules.
* Proficiency in communication skills, enabling effective and articulate interaction with students, colleagues, and interested parties.
* Ability to comfortably commute to the designated location.


If you are confident in meeting these minimal qualifications, we encourage you to proceed with your application.


Pay: $35.52/hour


SmartStart Education participates in e-verify.

title: Case Planner, New Brighton
description:
HeartShare is looking for a Caseworker in our Group Homes.


The Caseworker or the Case Planner enhances the quality of life of Group Home residents and their families by providing and/or arranging for the provision of social and related services based on service plans and needs; prepares youngsters for return to the natural family, independent living or continues care; Maintains compliance with Agency and Group Home standards, and government requirements.


Reports to: Case Planner Supervisor, Youth Residential Service

**Responsibilities**:

* Develops individual case service plans, using GH (Group Home) and SVS guidelines and governmental objectives
* Determines service needs
* Finds appropriate resources
* Schedules appointments for and escorts clients to resources as needed
* Enrolls clients in appropriate schools and programs
* Monitors service delivery and progress
* Maintains family assessment and service plans (FASP's) per NYS Office of Children and Family Services requirements and follows NYC Children Services (NYCCS) in service provision planning.
* Prepares and obtains pertinent documents and enters information into Connections and/or FASP.
* Initiates and maintains contacts internally and externally with collateral stakeholders as well as major stakeholders.
* Prepares and presents services plans and updates to Agency management, child care staff, clinicians and others as requested.
* Prepares required materials, such as lists of approved visiting resources and schools or programs for the Child Care Manual.
* Participates in meetings, including interdisciplinary team, monthly child care/social services, weekly individual and group, and others as requested; occasionally prepares minutes or summaries of meetings to be documented in Connections.
* Attends internal and external conferences, seminars, workshops and in-service training sessions.
* Makes field visits to outside organizations, such as schools, programs, and clients' family homes.
* Contributes to planning of and participates in quality recreational events, including ethno-cultural activities and overnight out-of-state trips; At least every two months escorts residents on weekend day recreation trips.
* Provides or arranges for the provision of counseling services to residents and their families.
* Diligently searches for missing residents (AWOL), files a missing persons report with police, and obtains a warrant from a family court judge and files in the case record a copy of the police report and warrant. Document efforts to find the missing resident in Connections.
* Covers a caseload of from twelve to fifteen residents, plus any and all aftercare clients, as defined by NYS OCFS and assigned by GH.
* College Bachelors Degree in human services or a related field preferred; Bachelors degree with two or more years working in a human service field required.
* Valid NYS Drivers License preferred; not required
* Experience in dealing with at risk youth in a residential setting or prior foster care experience and knowledge of NYSDSS regulations and FASPs; familiarity with Child Welfare systems (NYCCS), including knowledge or resources available to the foster care population in general and to the severely emotionally disturbed (SED) and/or developmentally disabled.
* Must have good verbal and writing skills, and the ability to communicate cogently and succinctly.
* Must be organized and efficiently coordinate work and schedules; must be able to plan, organize and lead case review and other meetings.
* Must be available to work some weekends and after scheduled work hours for urgent matters or planned activities, including possible overnight trips.
* Must have good interpersonal skills in relating to adolescents, co-workers and external and community resources.
* Must exhibit maturity and control of emotions, plus firmness and warmth, in order to command the respect and confidence of children in care and staff.
* Must have cross cultural studies or experience which benefit understanding of a diverse client population.

**Benefits:**

* Rewarding Work in a team environment;
* Paid vacation, sick, personal days and holidays;
* 403(B) retirement plan with employer contribution;
* Health, dental, vision and life insurance;
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
* Flexible spending account (Dependent Care, Medical, Parking, and Transit);
* Employee Appreciation Programs and Events;
* Tuition Assistance Program;
* Professional Development opportunities;
* Verizon Wireless Discount;
* BJs Membership discount;
* Gympass
* Discounts on Broadway tickets, movie tickets, theme parks, sporting events, gift certificates & more.


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.
company_description: Supporting and empowering people with disabilities, children in foster care, low-income families and other vulnerable New Yorkers.

title: Duane Reade Cashier
description:
Founded in 1960, Duane Reade is the largest drug store chain in the metropolitan New York City area, offering a variety of prescription and over-the-counter drugs, health and beauty care items, cosmetics, greeting cards, photo supplies, and photofinishing.  

  

A cashier is the last point of sale so the cashier should be able to leave a lasting impression on the customer to want to come back. A Cashier is responsible for maintaining outstanding customer service as per Company standards, processing sales quickly, accurately and efficiently, cash register operations and safeguarding company assets.  

  

Key Responsibilities:  

* Greet customers entering Duane Reade location
* Process all sale transactions by receiving payment by cash, check, credit cards, vouchers, or automatic debits.
* Process merchandise returns and exchanges.
* Register customers for the Dollar Reward Savings Club card.
* Answer customers' questions, and provide information on procedures or policies.
* Compute and record totals of transactions.
* Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
* Issue receipts, refunds, credits, or change due to customers.
* Issue trading stamps, and redeem food stamps and coupons (if applicable).
* Maintain clean and orderly checkout areas.
* Monitor checkout stations to ensure that they have adequate cash available and that they are staffed appropriately.
* Resolve customer complaints.
* Compile and maintain non-monetary reports and records.
* Stock shelves, and mark prices on shelves and items.


  

**Basic Qualifications**  

* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English.
* Requires willingness to work flexible schedule, including evenings and weekend hours.

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Duane Reade.

  

An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.  

  

The actual compensation that you will be offered will depend on a variety of factors including geography, skills and abilities, education, experience and other relevant factors. This role will remain open until filled. To review benefits, please click here jobs.walgreens.com/benefits. If you are applying on a job board or unable to click on the link, please copy and paste this URL into your browser jobs.walgreens.com/benefits

title: Duane Reade Shift Leader
description:
Duane Reade is seeking a dynamic, flexible and motivated team player to join our team of management professionals as a Shift Leader. Duane Reade offers a fast-paced and challenging work environment. We provide our Shift Leaders with the tools, training and support they need to be successful in leading a Duane Reade store; focusing on being a store that has a uniquely rewarding flare for our customers. The Shift Leader will assume general responsibility for the store in the absence of the assistant manager.  

  

**Essential Duties and Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*** Manage and track store financial performance, cash control, inventory, safety, customer service and management of entire staff.
* Support assistant manager in the execution of all company initiatives.
* Lead by example and ensure the entire staff is providing superior customer service.
* Ensure price integrity is maintained to comply with weights and measures.
* Ensure compliance to applicable labor laws, legal requirements, company policy, and the collective bargaining agreement.
* Maintain positive working relationships with direct reports, peers, vendors, union officials, and corporate office personnel.
* Ensure marketing initiatives, plano-grams, and store conditions are compliant with the corporate standard.
* Prioritize, plan and coordinate work activities for the entire staff using effective time management skills.
* Ensure store is well stocked and product is rotated accordingly using a state of the art replenishment system.
* Establish and maintain a friendly hospitable harassment-free work environment.
* Motivate and lead others to perform a variety of tasks that all lead to one common objective.

  

**Basic Qualifications**  

* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English.
* Six months of prior work experience with Duane Reade, with a performance evaluation on file or one year of prior retail work experience as a retail key carrier or shift leader (external candidates).
* Willingness to work flexible schedule, including evening and weekend hours.
* “Achieves expectations” rating on last performance review.

  

**Preferred Qualifications*** Prefer the knowledge of store inventory control.


An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.  

  

The actual compensation that you will be offered will depend on a variety of factors including geography, skills and abilities, education, experience and other relevant factors.
